net.hudup.core.client

Interface ServerStatusListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, java.rmi.Remote, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Balancer, BalancerCP, ExternalServerCP, Listener, ListenerCP, PowerServerCP, RemoteServerCP, ServerTrayIcon

    public interface ServerStatusListener
extends java.util.EventListener, java.rmi.Remote, java.io.Serializable
    Server represented by Server class has six statuses as follows:
    • "started": Server started. If server has just started right after calling Server#start(), it is in two statuses: "started" and "running".
    • "paused": Server paused. Server are currently in both "started" status and "paused" status.
    • "resumed": Server resumed. Server are currently in three statuses: "started", "resumed", and "running".
    • "stopped": Server stopped and so server is in "stopped" status.
    • "setconfig": Server is in setting its configuration. Sever must stop so that it can set its configuration. So server is now in two statuses: "stopped" and "setconfig".
    • "exit": Server exits and so server does not exist. Status "exit" is unreal.
    Some statuses are overlapped; for example, server is in status "paused" is also in status "started". Server changes its current status by calling methods such as Server#start(), Server#pause(), Server#resume(), Server#stop(), and Server#exit(). Methods such as Server#isStarted(), Server#isPaused(), and Server#isRunning() are used to query current status of server. Every time server change its current status, it notifies an event ServerStatusEvent to listeners that implement this ServerStatusListener interface. Such listeners are called server status listeners, which must be registered with server by method #addStatusListener(ServerStatusListener) to receive server status events. A server status event is removed from server by calling #removeStatusListener(ServerStatusListener).

    Server status listener defines its method statusChanged(ServerStatusEvent) to do some particular tasks when received server status event from server.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void statusChanged(ServerStatusEvent evt)
      Any class implementing this interface is responsible for defining this method statusChanged(ServerStatusEvent) to do some particular tasks when received server status event from server.

    • Method Detail

      • statusChanged

        void statusChanged(ServerStatusEvent evt)
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Any class implementing this interface is responsible for defining this method statusChanged(ServerStatusEvent) to do some particular tasks when received server status event from server.
        Parameters:
        evt - specified status event received from Server.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.
